title: CSS Lists
subject: CSS
learning_objectives: Style standard lists into navigation menus
theory:
In HTML, there are two main types of lists: unordered (`<ul>`) and ordered (`<ol>`). CSS list properties allow you to:

*   Set different list item markers (circle, square, roman numerals).
*   Set an image as the list item marker.
*   Set the background color lists and list items.

common_mistakes.correction: Apply it to the parent <ul> or <ol> usually, though applying to <li> also works, it's less efficient for the whole list.

interview_questions.question: How do you remove the bullets from a list?

practice_problems.problem: Make an ordered list use lowercase letters (a, b, c).

real_world_use_cases.description: Sidebars are almost always unstyled lists <ul> where <li> elements are styled as block links.

summary: Lists are versatile structure elements. With CSS, they transform from simple bullet points to complex navigation systems.
